derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (denoting the relative position of celestial objects): from late Latin configuratio(n-), from Latin configurare 'shape after a pattern' (see configure)

entry.def: A configuration is an arrangement of a group of things.

example.ex: ...Stonehenge, in south-western England, an ancient configuration of giant stones.
example.tran: 英格兰西南部的巨石阵——一座古老的巨石阵列

entry.def: The configuration of a computer system is way in which all its parts, such as the hardware and software, are connected together in order for the computer to work.

example.ex: Prices range from $119 to $199, depending on the particular configuration.
example.tran: 价格因具体配置而异，从119美元至199美元不等。

means.word_mean: 1. an arrangement of parts or elements;

sentences.sentence: "the outcome depends on the configuration of influences at the time"

means.word_mean: 2. any spatial attributes (especially as defined by outline);

sentences.sentence: "he could barely make out their shapes through the smoke"
